source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊食訖，還至彼林經行。
translation: "After finishing his meal, the Bhagavān returned to that forest to walk around.

source_sentence: 是時，優婁頻螺迦葉過彼夜後，往至佛所，到已白佛：『大德沙門，若知時者，飯食已辦。』
translation: After the night passed, Ulūkaśvara Kāśyapa went to the Buddha and when he arrived, he said to him, 'Venerable ascetic, if you knew the time, the meal would have been ready.'

source_sentence: 佛告迦葉：『汝於先去，我隨後來。』
translation: The Buddha told Kāśyapa, 'After you go first, I'll come after you.'

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊於先發遣迦葉去後，即往到彼三十三天，到彼天已，取得一華，其華名波梨闍多迦(隋言彼岸生)，取已於先來火神堂。
translation: After sending Kāśyapa away, the Bhagavān then went to the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven and when he arrived there, he obtained a flower named pārijātaka (Sui term for birth on the other side), which he placed in the fire deities' hall from before.

source_sentence: 迦葉後來，見佛已坐。
translation: Kāśyapa came back later and saw the Buddha sitting there.

source_sentence: 即白佛言：『大德沙門！
translation: He said to the Buddha, 'Venerable ascetic!

source_sentence: 從何道來？
translation: How did it come about?

source_sentence: 在於我前，到火神堂。』
translation: Go before me to the fire deity's hall.'

source_sentence: 「佛告迦葉：『我先遣汝，後至忉利天宮，將此波梨闍華來此神堂，然此波梨闍多迦華，顏色可愛，香氣甚好，汝意若樂，可取此華嗅其香氣。』
translation: "The Buddha told Kāśyapa, 'I first sent you, then I went to the palace of the Heaven of Thirty-three and brought this pārijāta flower to this shrine hall, but this pārijāta flower has a lovely color and a very nice fragrance; if it pleases you, you may take this flower and smell its fragrance.'

source_sentence: 迦葉白佛：『大德沙門！
translation: Kāśyapa said to the Buddha, 'Venerable monks!

source_sentence: 此華香氣，微妙精好，沙門自持，我不合嗅。』
translation: The fragrance of this flower is so subtle and fine that an ascetic would hold it himself, but I wouldn't smell it.'

source_sentence: 是時，迦葉作如是念：『此大沙門，大有威力！
translation: Kāśyapa then had this thought, 'This great ascetic is mighty!

source_sentence: 大有神通！
translation: Great supernatural powers!

source_sentence: 乃能於先發遣我已，後到天上，取彼波梨闍多迦華，於先來坐火神堂內；雖然，猶不得阿羅漢身心寂靜如我今也。』
translation: After sending me away, he then went up to heaven and got the flower of the pārijātaka and put it in the fire deity's hall where he had been sitting before; still, he couldn't attain the serenity of an arhat's body and mind that I have now.'

source_sentence: 爾時，迦葉居處，螺髻諸梵志等，欲破於柴而不能得，若倚立者，不能屈身，若低腰時，不能正直，若斧著柴，拔不能出。
translation: At the time, while Kāśyapa was staying there, the conch-tufted priests and others who wanted to break through the firewood couldn't get it; if they stood, they couldn't bend over; if they lowered their heads, they couldn't straighten up; and if they put their axes to the firewood, they couldn't pull it out.

source_sentence: 爾時，彼等螺髻梵志作如是念：『此之神通，必當是彼大沙門作，無有疑也，乃令我等今日不能破此柴薪，極甚勞苦。』
translation: Those conch-tufted priests then thought, 'Surely this is the work of that great ascetic, of whom there's no doubt, which has prevented us from breaking through this firewood today and caused us great suffering.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊告彼優婁頻螺迦葉一切等言：『螺髻迦葉！
translation: "It was then that the Bhagavān addressed all of them, saying, 'Kālôdayin Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 汝等今欲破於薪耶？』
translation: Do you now wish to refute the firewood?'

source_sentence: 迦葉白佛：『大德沙門！
translation: Kāśyapa said to the Buddha, 'Venerable monks!

source_sentence: 實欲破薪，而不能得。』
translation: They really wanted to break firewood, but they couldn't.'

source_sentence: 是時，佛作如是語已，彼等梵志即得自恣破其薪柴。
translation: After the Buddha said this, those priests then broke their firewood at their own will.

source_sentence: 是時，優婁頻螺迦葉作如是念：『此大沙門，大有威力，大有神通；雖然，猶不得阿羅漢如我今也。』
translation: Uluvilvā-Kāśyapa then had this thought, 'This great ascetic has great authority and great supernormal powers; still, he couldn't be an arhat like me today.'

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊食訖，還向彼林經行。
translation: After he finished his meal, the Bhagavān returned to the other grove and walked around.

source_sentence: 是時優婁頻螺迦葉所居住處，欲燃火燭而不能著。
translation: At the time, Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa was staying at a place where he wanted to light a candle, but it wouldn't burn.

source_sentence: 是時彼等螺髻梵志作如是念：『此之神通，必是彼大沙門所作，無有疑也，而令我等，如是辛苦，火不能燃。』
translation: Those conch-tufted priests then thought, 'That great ascetic must have done this, without any doubt, and caused us to work so hard that the fire couldn't burn it.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊告彼優婁頻螺迦葉一切等言：『迦葉！
translation: "It was then that the Bhagavān addressed all of them at Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa, saying, 'Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 汝等欲燃火耶？』
translation: Do you want to start a fire?'

source_sentence: 是時彼等迦葉報言：『大德沙門！
translation: Those Kāśyapa then replied, 'Venerable ascetic!

source_sentence: 我欲燃火。』
translation: I want to start a fire.'

source_sentence: 時佛問已，彼火即燃五百火聚。
translation: After the Buddha asked, that fire then ignited a cluster of five hundred fires.

source_sentence: 是時優婁頻螺迦葉，作如是念：『此大沙門，大有威力！
translation: Uluvilvā-Kāśyapa then had this thought, 'This great ascetic is very powerful!'

source_sentence: 大有神通！
translation: Great supernatural powers!

source_sentence: 乃能令彼可燃之火不聽其燃，若欲令燃，方始即燃；雖爾，猶不得阿羅漢如我今也。』
translation: Only then can they cause a combustible fire not to hear it burn, and only then will it burn if they want it to; even so, they still can't be an arhat like me today.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊食訖，還向彼林經行。
translation: "After he finished his meal, the Bhagavān returned to the forest and walked around.

source_sentence: 爾時，彼等螺髻梵志欲滅於火而不能得。
translation: At the time, those conch-tufted priests wanted to extinguish the fire, but they couldn't get it.

source_sentence: 爾時，彼等螺髻梵志，作如是念：『此是沙門神通之力，而令我等火炎欲滅不能得滅。』
translation: Those conch-tufted priests then had this thought, 'This is the ascetic's supernormal power that made it impossible to extinguish the fire that we wanted to extinguish.'

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告迦葉言：『迦葉！
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed Kāśyapa, saying, 'Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 汝等今欲滅於此火炎耶？』
translation: Do you want to put out this fire now?'

source_sentence: 迦葉白佛：『大德沙門！
translation: Kāśyapa said to the Buddha, 'Venerable monks!

source_sentence: 我今欲得滅此火炎，而不能得。』
translation: Now, I want to extinguish these flames, but I can't.'

source_sentence: 時佛問已，即得滅於五百火炎。
translation: After the Buddha asked, he was able to extinguish 500 flames.

source_sentence: 爾時，迦葉作如是念：『此大沙門大有威力！
translation: At that point, Kāśyapa thought, 'That great ascetic is mighty!'

source_sentence: 大有神通！
translation: Great supernatural powers!

source_sentence: 其力乃能滅火即滅，欲燃即燃，雖爾；猶不得阿羅漢如我今也。』
translation: Even so, it's not possible for an arhat like me to be ignited even though his power can extinguish a fire and set it on fire when he wants it to burn.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊食訖已後，還至彼林經行而住。
translation: "After he finished his meal, the Bhagavān went back to that forest, walked around, and stayed there.

source_sentence: 是時，彼等螺髻梵志至極寒冬，天正夜半，或至後夜，嚴酷凍冷，多有風雪，入於尼連禪河水中，或沒或出，如是澡浴。
translation: It was then that those conch-tufted priests went into the water of the Nairañjāna River in the dead of winter, at midnight or late at night when it was freezing cold and there was a lot of snow and wind, and they submerged themselves in or emerged from the water, bathing themselves like this.

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊以神通力，化作五百赤炭火聚，在彼岸邊。
translation: "At the time, the Bhagavān used his supernormal powers to create a cluster of 500 red-hot coals on the shore.

source_sentence: 是時，彼等螺髻梵志寒噤出水住在岸邊，各各向火。
translation: Those conch-tufted priests then became frightened, got out of the water, and stayed on the shore, each facing the fire.

source_sentence: 是時，彼等螺髻梵志心如是念：『此必定是彼大沙門作是神變，忽然有此五百火鑪，而無烟炎，使於我等從冷水出向火炙煖。』
translation: Those conch-tufted priests then had this thought in their minds, 'Surely this must be the great ascetic's miraculous transformation, suddenly creating these five hundred fire altars without smoke or heat, so that we emerge from the cold water and turn to the fire to warm ourselves.'

source_sentence: 是時，優婁頻螺迦葉作如是念：『此大沙門大有威力！
translation: Then, Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa thought, 'That great ascetic is mighty!'

source_sentence: 大有神通！
translation: Great supernatural powers!

source_sentence: 乃能化作五百鑪火，無有烟炎，令我螺髻五百弟子從冷水出向火煖坐，雖然；猶不得阿羅漢如我今也。』
translation: That would make five hundred fireplaces, with no smoke or heat, that would cause my five hundred conch-tufted disciples to emerge from the cold water and sit toward the fire, even though they wouldn't be arhats like me now.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊食訖已後，還至彼林，經行而住。
translation: "After he finished his meal, the Bhagavān went back to that forest and stayed there while walking.

source_sentence: 是時，彼等螺髻梵志欲取於水，各手持瓶，或將軍持，欲用取水而不能捉。
translation: Those conch-tufted priests then wanted to get some water, so they each took a flask in their hand or carried it in their army, wanting to use it to get water but were unable to grasp it.

source_sentence: 是時，彼等螺髻梵志作如是念：『此必是彼大沙門作，而令我等，不能取瓶及以軍持。』
translation: Those conch-tufted priests then thought, 'That great ascetic must have done this, making it impossible for us to take the flask and carry it in our armies.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊告彼優婁頻螺迦葉并及五百螺髻梵志一切等言：『迦葉！
translation: "It was then that the Bhagavān addressed that Kāśyapa Ulūpiṇḍa and the five hundred conch-tufted priests, saying, 'Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 汝等各欲將瓶及軍持等欲取水乎？』
translation: Do you each want to bring a clay pot or an army bearer to get water?'

source_sentence: 迦葉白言：『善哉沙門！
translation: Kāśyapa said, 'Good, ascetic!

source_sentence: 此等五百螺髻梵志，將瓶軍持欲取於水。』
translation: These five hundred conch-tufted priests will put together a pot and an army to hold it in order to get water.'

source_sentence: 時佛問已，而其五百螺髻梵志皆能將瓶及軍持等，得取於水。
translation: After the Buddha asked, these five hundred conch-tufted priests were all able to put together a clay pot and an army of armaments to obtain the water.

source_sentence: 「爾時，優婁頻螺迦葉作如是念：『希有希有！
translation: "At the time, Ulūkaśvara Kāśyapa thought, 'Rare, rare!'

source_sentence: 此大沙門大有威力！
translation: This great brāhmaṇa is very powerful!

source_sentence: 大有神通！
translation: Great supernatural powers!

source_sentence: 乃能令此五百螺髻諸梵志等，許其取水乃能得水，不許不得；雖然，猶不得阿羅漢如我今也。』
translation: That would enable these 500 priests with conch knots to obtain water if they were allowed to take it, but not if they weren't allowed to take it; even though, it wouldn't be like being an arhat like me now.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊食訖已後，還至彼林，經行而住。
translation: "After he finished his meal, the Bhagavān went back to that forest and stayed there while walking.

source_sentence: 是時，優婁頻螺迦葉，其於已前，祭祀火時，恒常坐七多羅樹上，於後祭祀，還欲上七多羅樹上而不能上。
translation: At the time, Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa, who had always sat on one of the seven palm trees during the fire sacrifice, wanted to go back up to one of the seven palm trees after the sacrifice but couldn't.

source_sentence: 「爾時，優婁頻螺迦葉作如是念：『決定是彼大沙門作神通無疑，令我不能上此多羅樹上祭火。』
translation: "At the time, Ulūpaṃkara Kāśyapa thought, 'Surely that great ascetic has performed miraculous powers without doubt, making it impossible for me to go up this palm tree to sacrifice to the fire.'

source_sentence: 是時，迦葉作如是念：『此大沙門大有威力！
translation: Kāśyapa then had this thought, 'That great ascetic is very powerful!

source_sentence: 大有神通！
translation: Great supernatural powers!

source_sentence: 乃能如是，不許我等上於樹者則不能上；雖然，猶不得阿羅漢如我今也。』
translation: They would be able to do so, and those of us who aren't allowed to go up into the trees wouldn't be able to; although it wouldn't be like an arhat like me now.'

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊食訖已後，還至彼林，經行而住。
translation: After he had finished his meal, the Bhagavān returned to the forest and stayed there while walking.

source_sentence: 是時，優婁頻螺迦葉上七多羅樹上祭祀，上已不能安隱而住。
translation: Having gone up into one of the seven tāla trees to offer sacrifice, Ulū Piṅgala-kāśyapa couldn't stay there in comfort.

source_sentence: 爾時，優婁頻螺迦葉作如是念：『決定是彼大沙門作神通無疑，令我上此七多羅樹舊住處坐，不能得住，復更欲上。』
translation: At the time, Ulūkaśvara Kāśyapa thought, 'Surely that great ascetic has done something miraculous and without doubt to make me go up to sit in my old dwelling place in this tree of seven tāras, but I couldn't stay there, so I wanted to go up again.'

source_sentence: 而白佛言：『善哉沙門！
translation: He said to the Buddha, 'Good, ascetic!

source_sentence: 願聽我等依舊住此七多羅樹祭祀於火。』
translation: May you allow us to continue to stand on these seven tāla trees and offer sacrifices to the fire?'

source_sentence: 時佛語已，其迦葉等即得依舊安住彼七多羅樹上。
translation: After the Buddha said that, those Kāśyapa people were allowed to remain standing on those seven talas trees.

source_sentence: 「爾時，優婁頻螺迦葉作如是念：『此大沙門大有威力！
translation: "At the time, Ulūkaśvara Kāśyapa thought, 'That great ascetic is very powerful!'

source_sentence: 大有神通！
translation: Great supernatural powers!

source_sentence: 乃能許我住則得住，不許不得；雖然，猶不得阿羅漢如我今也。』
translation: If he allows me to stay, then he'll be able to stay; if he doesn't allow him to stay, he won't be able to stay; although he might not be an arhat like me now.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊食訖已後，還至彼林，經行而住。
translation: "After he finished his meal, the Bhagavān returned to the forest and stayed there while walking.

source_sentence: 是時，優婁頻螺迦葉祭祀火訖，欲覆藏置，即不能覆。
translation: After he finished the fire sacrifice, Ulūpiṃśvara Kāśyapa wanted to cover the stash, but he couldn't.

source_sentence: 是時，優婁頻螺迦葉作如是念：『決定是彼沙門瞿曇作此神通，令我等輩不得覆火。』
translation: Ulūkaśvara Kāśyapa then had this thought, 'Surely that ascetic Gautama has done this miraculous act to prevent us from covering the fire.'

source_sentence: 是時，迦葉即白佛言：『善哉沙門！
translation: Kāśyapa then said to the Buddha, 'Good, ascetic!

source_sentence: 願令我等得覆此火。』
translation: May it be possible for us to cover this fire.'

source_sentence: 作是語已，即得覆火。
translation: After saying this, they were able to cover the fire.

source_sentence: 「爾時，迦葉作如是念：『此大沙門大有威力！
translation: "At the time, Kāśyapa thought, 'That great ascetic is mighty!'

source_sentence: 大有神通！
translation: Great supernatural powers!

source_sentence: 乃能如是，許覆得覆，不許不得；雖然，猶不得阿羅漢如我今也。』
translation: He could thus permit coverage and not permit it, though it wouldn't be like an arhat like me now.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊食訖，還至彼舊林中，經行而住。
translation: "After he finished his meal, the Bhagavān went back to that old forest and stayed there while walking.

source_sentence: 是時，迦葉祭祀火時，火及木頭，東西馳走，不能一住。
translation: When Kāśyapa was sacrificing to the fire, the fire and the wood rode off to the east and west, and they couldn't stay together.

source_sentence: 是時，迦葉作如是念：『決定是彼沙門瞿曇作是神通，令我祭祀火之器具，東西馳走，狀若人驅，不能定住。』
translation: Kāśyapa then had this thought, 'Surely that ascetic Gautama did this miraculous act to cause my fire sacrifice implements to move east and west in the shape of a human being driving them away, unable to stay put.'

source_sentence: 即白佛言：『善哉沙門！
translation: He then said to the Buddha, 'Good, ascetic!

source_sentence: 願令我此祭祀火具得一定住。』
translation: May this sacrificial fire apparatus of mine be certainly maintained.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，佛告彼迦葉言：『如汝等意。』
translation: "At that point, the Buddha told that Kāśyapa, 'As you wish.'

source_sentence: 其祭火具即得安定。
translation: The sacrificial fire altar was then stabilized.

source_sentence: 因此緣故，其迦葉等作如是念：『此大沙門大有威力！
translation: For this reason, those Kāśyapa people thought, 'This great ascetic is very powerful!'

source_sentence: 大有神通！
translation: Great supernatural powers!

source_sentence: 乃能許我祭祀火器住則得住，不許不住；雖然，猶不得阿羅漢如我今也。』
translation: He would then allow me to offer firearms for worship and obtain permission to stay, but he wouldn't allow me to stay, even though he wouldn't be an arhat like me now.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊食訖已後，還至彼林，經行而住。
translation: "After he finished his meal, the Bhagavān went back to that forest and stayed there while walking.

source_sentence: 是時彼處，忽爾非時其虛空中起大黑雲、降大暴雨，佛所居處，無有雨水。
translation: There, suddenly, at an ungodly hour, a great black cloud rose in the sky and a great downpour fell, and there was no rain where the Buddha was staying.

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊作如是念：『我今可令此水遍布，而於水內，復見乾地，令有塵起，現經行處，於彼往來。』
translation: "At the time, the Bhagavān had this thought, 'Now, I could cause this water to spread out, and within the water, I'd see dry ground again, causing dust to arise and appear as a place of walking, and I'd go there.'

source_sentence: 作是念已，即現如前乾地塵坌，來去經行。
translation: After he had this thought, he then manifested the dust of the dry ground as before, coming and going through the course.

source_sentence: 「爾時，迦葉作如是念：『今既非時，虛空之中云何忽爾非時起雲而降大雨？
translation: "Kāśyapa then had this thought, 'Now, since this is not the right time, why did clouds suddenly arise in the sky at an ungodly hour and send down a great rain?'

source_sentence: 此大沙門所住之處，亦一種有大水彌滿。
translation: 'Where this great ascetic lives, there's also a great flood that fills the place.

source_sentence: 此之沙門，或可為水之所沒溺，或今不見？』
translation: Could this ascetic have been submerged by the water, or is he nowhere to be seen?'

source_sentence: 作是念已，多將螺髻諸梵志等坐於船中，處處求覓，漸至佛所，到佛所已，如是而住。
translation: After this thought, the priests sitting in the boat with the conch-tuft in their heads searched everywhere for a way to reach the Buddha, and when they arrived at the Buddha's place, they stayed there like this.

source_sentence: 「爾時，迦葉既見世尊兩邊有水，唯獨中間，現於乾地，塵土坌起，來去經行。
translation: "It was then that Kāśyapa saw the Bhagavān with water on either side but only in the middle, where he was on dry ground, dusty, and walking back and forth.

source_sentence: 見已白佛：『大德沙門！
translation: After he saw this, he said to the Buddha, 'Venerable ascetic!

source_sentence: 今住在此大水中乎？』
translation: Are you now living in this great water?'

source_sentence: 佛言：『住此。』
translation: The Buddha said, 'Stay here.'

source_sentence: 作是語已，飛騰虛空，即便往詣迦葉船上。
translation: After he said this, he soared through the sky and went to Kāśyapa's boat.

source_sentence: 「爾時迦葉因此緣故，作如是念：『此大沙門大有神通！
translation: "It was for this reason that Kāśyapa thought, 'This great ascetic has great supernormal powers!'

source_sentence: 大有威力！
translation: Greatly powerful!

source_sentence: 乃能在水作是道行；雖然，猶不得阿羅漢如我今也。』
translation: It's possible to do this kind of pathwork in water, even though it's not yet an arhat like me today.'

source_sentence: 「（摩訶僧祇作如是說：『如來為彼優婁頻螺迦葉等輩，示現如是五百神通，而彼優婁頻螺迦葉於一切時，作如是念：「此大沙門大有威力！
translation: "(Mahāsāṃghika) said, 'The Tathāgata showed these five hundred supernormal powers to this group of Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa and others, and at all times that Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa thought, 'This great ascetic is enormously powerful!'

source_sentence: 大有神通！
translation: Great supernatural powers!

source_sentence: 雖復變現德術如此，而其唯不得阿羅漢，如我今也。」』
translation: Even though he's been shown to have such virtues, he's only not an arhat, like me now.'"

source_sentence: ）「爾時，世尊作如是念：『此之癡人，於無量時有如是念：「此大沙門有大威力！
translation: ) "At that point, the Bhagavān had this thought, 'This foolish man had this thought for an immeasurable amount of time, 'This great ascetic has great authority!'

source_sentence: 有大神通！
translation: There is great supernatural power!

source_sentence: 雖然，而不得阿羅漢如我今也。」
translation: Although it's true, I wouldn't attain arhatship like I am now."

source_sentence: 而我今可為此迦葉及諸弟子令開慧眼，發厭離心。』
translation: Now, I can open the eyes of wisdom for this Kāśyapa and his disciples and cause them to become disillusioned with the mind.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊告彼優婁頻螺迦葉作如是言：『迦葉汝今非阿羅漢，亦復未入阿羅漢道，而汝實無阿羅漢相，況復得於阿羅漢果？』
translation: "It was then that the Bhagavān addressed that Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa and said, 'Kāśyapa, you are not an arhat now, nor have you yet entered the arhat path; you really don't have the characteristics of an arhat, so how could you attain the fruit of the arhat?'

source_sentence: 因於此言，時其優婁頻螺迦葉心生羞慚，身毛卓竪，頂禮佛足，而白佛言：『善哉！
translation: As a result of these words, Ulūkaśvara Kāśyapa was so ashamed and embarrassed that he stood up with his hair standing on end, bowed his head at the Buddha's feet, and said to him, 'Good!

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 與我出家，受具足戒。』
translation: Leave home with me and receive the full set of precepts.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊告彼優婁頻螺迦葉作如是言：『汝大迦葉！
translation: "At that point, the Bhagavān addressed that Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa and said, 'You great Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 此諸五百螺髻梵志依汝住止，順汝法行，汝可共其平量好惡，告語令知，如於彼等意情所樂，作如是事。』
translation: These five hundred conch-tufted priests rely on you to stay and practice according to your teachings, so you may together with them equally measure their good and bad qualities and tell them to do so, just as their intentions desire.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，優婁頻螺迦葉聞佛語已，即便往詣五百螺髻梵志之邊，到已告言：『汝等梵志摩那婆輩！
translation: "After hearing the Buddha's words, Ulūkaśvara Kāśyapa went over to the five hundred conch-tufted priests, and when he arrived, he told them, 'You priests of the Manabha group!

source_sentence: 從我受此居處住止，及奉火神所安堂室，及祭祀器，各隨汝等意樂而用；我今欲向大沙門邊，當行梵行。』
translation: Accept from me this dwelling place, this dwelling room for worshipping the fire deity, and this sacrificial vessel, each to be used as you like; now I want to go to the edge of the great ascetic and conduct myself as a priest.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，彼等五百弟子螺髻梵志共白優婁頻螺迦葉，作如是言：『和上！
translation: "At the time, those five hundred disciples, the conch-tufted priests, said to Uluvilvā-Kāśyapa in common, 'Venerable!

source_sentence: 自從見彼瞿曇大沙門來，我等多時意樂，欲往大沙門邊行於梵行，而為敬惜和上心故，口不發言。
translation: Since we saw that great ascetic Gautama, we've often had the desire to go to that great ascetic to practice the religious life, but we kept our mouths shut because we respected and respected the mind of Vairocana.

source_sentence: 和上今者若欲於彼大沙門邊行梵行者，我等亦當隨從而往，依彼教法。』
translation: If you, Vakkula, now want to practice the religious life at the side of that ascetic, we will also follow you there and follow his teachings.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，優婁頻螺迦葉及諸弟子往詣佛所，到佛所已，却住一面。
translation: "At the time, Ulūkaśvara Kāśyapa and his disciples went to the Buddha, and when they arrived, they withdrew to one side.

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告迦葉等言：『汝等梵志！
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed Kāśyapa and the others, 'You priests!

source_sentence: 可棄於汝鹿皮之衣，及軍持杖眾雜頭髻，令諸螺髻祭祀火神諸器皿等，種種調度，向彼尼連禪河水中，而皆擲却。』
translation: Perhaps you could discard your deerskin robes, your military staff, the many mixed topknots, the conch knots used to worship the fire deity, the utensils, and so forth, and arrange them all in the waters of the Nairañjāna River.

source_sentence: 是時，彼等即白佛言：『一如大德沙門教誨，我等不違。』
translation: They then said to the Buddha, 'Just as the great virtuous ascetic taught, we won't disobey him.'

source_sentence: 時諸梵志即將所著鹿皮之衣，乃至種種器皿調度，向彼河岸，悉擲水中。
translation: The priests then took the deerskin robes they were wearing and the various utensils they had adapted and threw them all into the water toward the river bank.

source_sentence: 彼等諸物擲水中已，作種種聲，或呹呹(子悉反)聲，而逐水流。
translation: After they tossed those things into the water, they made various sounds, or maybe the sound of a whelk (Zisig), and they chased the current.

source_sentence: 彼等螺髻，見於如是諸異事已，心中復更增益歡喜，頂禮佛足，而白佛言；『唯願世尊！
translation: After seeing these extraordinary things, those conch knots rejoiced even more in their hearts, bowed their heads at the Buddha's feet, and said to him, 'May it please the Bhagavān!'

source_sentence: 與我等輩，出家受戒。』
translation: We are the group that renounces the world and receives the precepts.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，佛告彼等梵志作如是言：『汝等比丘！
translation: "At that point, the Buddha addressed those priests and said, 'You monks!

source_sentence: 來入於我所說法中，行於梵行，盡諸苦故。』
translation: Come and enter my teaching, practice the religious life, and end suffering.'

source_sentence: 是時，彼等五百長老，應聲出家，即成具足。
translation: At the time, those five hundred elders responded by renouncing the house and became fully ordained.

source_sentence: 「于時，那提螺髻迦葉在尼連禪河水下流岸邊修道，見於彼等鹿皮之衣，及祭火神器皿調度，隨水沿流。
translation: "Nadī-Kauśalya was then cultivating on the bank of the Nairañjāna River as it flowed downstream when he saw those deerskin robes and fire sacrificial vessels flowing along with the water.

source_sentence: 見已懎然，心生恐怖，而發此言：『咄咄異事！
translation: He looked at them, looked blank, became frightened, and said, 'Duh, something different!'

source_sentence: 我兄或能為賊所破，不者居處被他殺也。
translation: My brother might be defeated by thieves, or he might be killed by others where he lives.

source_sentence: 我今可往至彼，觀察是何災禍變怪所致，忽然若斯。』
translation: Now, I can go there and examine what calamity or strange transformation caused him to suddenly do this.'

source_sentence: 爾時，其弟那提迦葉作是念已，先遣多人螺髻梵志詣彼逆看，好惡當告。
translation: After his brother Nadī-Kāśyapa thought this, he first sent a group of conch-tufted priests to go there to look around and tell them what was good and bad.

source_sentence: 『汝等撿挍，彼有何怪？
translation: 'You guys, check it out. What's so strange about it?'

source_sentence: 其事云何？』
translation: What are these things?'

source_sentence: 弟子奉教往彼看已，迴還報言：『並各平安，事瞿曇氏。』
translation: After the disciples were instructed to go there and look at them, they returned, saying, 'Each is safe and sound for the Gautama.'

source_sentence: 那提迦葉然後自將三百弟子，左右圍遶，往於長老優婁頻螺迦葉住處。
translation: Nadī-Kāśyapa then took 300 of his disciples and surrounded them on both sides as they went to the elder Ulū Piṅgala's residence.

source_sentence: 到已即見優婁頻螺迦葉師徒，剃除鬚髮，著袈裟衣。
translation: When they arrived, they saw Urubhiruci Kāśyapa's master and disciples, shaving off their hair and wearing robes.

source_sentence: 見已內心不大歡喜，向兄迦葉而說偈言：「『仁者虛祭祀火神，　　徒復空修於苦行，　　今日既捨此苦行，　　猶如蛇脫於故皮。』
translation: He wasn't overjoyed at first, so he said to his brother Kāśyapa, "Sir, you've made a false sacrifice to the fire deity and have cultivated an empty austerity practice.

source_sentence: 「爾時，那提螺髻迦葉即白長老優婁頻螺迦葉兄言：『此能勝也？』
translation: "At that point, Nadī-Kauśalya said to his elder brother Ulūpi-Kauśalya, 'Is this superior?'

source_sentence: 是時，長老優婁頻螺迦葉報言：『此實勝也！
translation: The elder Ulūkaśaila then reported, 'This is really something!

source_sentence: 寧為此行，此行最妙。』
translation: Rather than doing this, this is the most wonderful thing.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，那提螺髻迦葉告其三百螺髻梵志諸弟子言：『汝等螺髻摩那婆輩！
translation: "At the time, Nadī-Kauśika addressed his 300 conch-tufted priest disciples, saying, 'You conch-tufted Manabhū people!

source_sentence: 我彼居處，及泉池等，并諸調度，汝意自知，作何處分；我今欲在大沙門邊，當修梵行。』
translation: 'You should know where I live, what springs and pools I have, and how I'm disciplined; now, I want to cultivate the religious practice at the edge of the great monastery.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，彼等三百螺髻梵志弟子，白師那提螺髻迦葉作如是言：『和上今若欲往於彼大沙門邊修梵行者，我等亦當隨逐和上，同詣彼邊共修梵行。』
translation: "At the time, those 300 conch-tufted priest disciples said to their teacher, Nadī-Ketu Kāśyapa, 'If you want to go there now to practice the religious life at the edge of the great monastery, we will also follow you and go there together to practice the religious life.'

source_sentence: 爾時，那提螺髻迦葉及諸弟子，往詣佛所，到佛所已，却住一面。
translation: It was then that Nadī-Kauśalya and his disciples went to the Buddha, and when they arrived, they withdrew to one side.

source_sentence: 「爾時，佛告彼等梵志作如是言：『汝等今者能將身上所著鹿皮，及祭祀火器皿調度，擲置尼連禪河水中，棄去以不？』
translation: "The Buddha then addressed those priests, saying, 'Could you now toss the deerskin you're wearing and the fire-entering vessel you're using for the festival into the waters of the Nairañjāna River and discard it?'

source_sentence: 彼等梵志同白佛言：『如沙門教，我不敢違。』
translation: Those priests all said to the Buddha, 'As the ascetic taught, I dare not disobey him.'

source_sentence: 而彼等將如前調度，即擲水中，作呹呹聲，逐水而去。
translation: They then adjusted themselves as before, threw themselves into the water, made a beeping noise, and ran off into the water.

source_sentence: 爾時，彼諸螺髻梵志見如是等希有之事，復增歡喜，乃至彼等長老比丘，應時出家，即成具戒。
translation: Those conch-tufted priests then saw such a rare thing and became even more joyous, even as those elderly monks left home at the right time and became fully ordained.

source_sentence: 「爾時，伽耶螺髻迦葉在河下流，忽見鹿皮及祭祀火器皿調度隨水流下，見已心復生大恐怖，而發是言：『咄咄異事！
translation: "At the time, Gayāśoka Kāśyapa was downstream in the river when he suddenly saw a deer skin and a sacrificial fire-ware tureen flowing downstream, and when he saw them, his mind again became terrified, and he said, 'Duh!

source_sentence: 我兄或能被賊所破其居坐處，不被殺也？
translation: Perhaps my brother could have been attacked by thieves and his place of abiding and sitting prevented from being killed?

source_sentence: 我今可往至彼觀察為何災禍。』
translation: Now, I can go there and examine what kind of misfortune it is.'

source_sentence: 作是念已，先遣多人螺髻梵志，往彼逆看，好惡當告。
translation: After thinking this, he first sent many conch-tufted priests to look the other way and tell them what's good and bad.

source_sentence: 『汝等撿挍，彼有何怪？
translation: 'What's so strange about you inspecting that place?'

source_sentence: 其事云何？』
translation: What are these things?'

source_sentence: 弟子還報，如前所答。
translation: The disciples returned the favor, answering as before.

source_sentence: 爾時，伽耶螺髻迦葉然後自將二百弟子，左右圍遶，往於長老優婁頻螺，并及那提二迦葉邊，到已即見二迦葉身，剃除髻髮，著袈裟衣。
translation: It was then that Gayāśoka Kāśyapa then gathered 200 of his disciples around him and went to the elder Ulū Piṅgala and the two Nadī Kāśyapa brothers, and when he arrived, he saw the two Kāśyapa brothers in person, shaved off their hair in a bun, and clad in robes.

source_sentence: 見已內心不大歡喜，向於二兄優婁、那提兩迦葉邊，而說偈言：「『兄等昔空祭火神，　　亦復徒修於苦行，　　今日既共捨此等，　　猶如蛇脫彼故皮。』
translation: He was not overjoyed at first, so he went over to his brothers Ulū and Nadī and said, "Brothers, we used to worship the fire deity in vain and also cultivated ascetic practices in vain.

source_sentence: 「爾時，優婁頻螺迦葉并及長老那提迦葉，還共以偈報弟伽耶螺髻梵志，作如是言：「『我等昔空祭火神，　　我等亦徒修苦行，　　我等今得捨此法，　　實如蛇脫彼故皮。』
translation: "At the time, Ulū Piṅgala Kāśyapa and the elder Nadī-Kāśyapa also spoke together in verse to their younger brother, Gayāśakusumitra, saying, 'In the past, we made empty offerings to the fire deity, and we also cultivated ascetic practices in vain; now, we've abandoned this teaching, which is really like a snake shedding its old skin.'

source_sentence: 「爾時伽耶螺髻迦葉，復問優婁頻螺迦葉并及那提迦葉等言：『兄今此處，實能勝也？』
translation: "It was then that Gayāśoka-Kāśyapa again asked Ulū Piṅgala-Kāśyapa and Nadī-Kāśyapa, saying, 'Brother, is this place really superior?'

source_sentence: 是時，長老二迦葉言：『此處實勝！
translation: It was then that the elder Er Kāśyapa said, 'This place is really superior!

source_sentence: 寧為此行，此行最妙。』
translation: Rather than doing this, this is the most wonderful thing.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，伽耶螺髻迦葉告其二百螺髻梵志諸弟子言：『汝等梵志摩那婆輩！
translation: "It was then that Gayāśoka Kāśyapa addressed his 200 disciples of the conch-tufted priests, saying, 'You priests, Manabhū people!

source_sentence: 我彼居處所有泉池，并諸調度，汝意自知，作何處分；我今欲在大沙門邊修學梵行。』
translation: 'You should know where I live, where I have springs and pools, and what place I've made for them; now, I want to train in the religious practice at the edge of that great monastery.'

source_sentence: 爾時，彼等二百螺髻梵志弟子，白師伽耶螺髻迦葉作如是言：『和上今若欲往於彼大沙門邊行梵行者，我等亦當隨逐和上，一時同詣大沙門邊共修梵行。』
translation: It was then that those 200 conch-tufted priest disciples said to their teacher, Gayāśoka Kāśyapa, 'If you want to practice the religious life at the edge of that great monastery, we will also follow you and go to the edge of the great monastery together to practice the religious life.'

source_sentence: 是時，伽耶螺髻迦葉及其弟子，往詣佛所，到佛所已，却住一面，而白佛言：『大德沙門！
translation: Gayāśoka-Kāśyapa and his disciples then went to the Buddha, and when they arrived, they withdrew to one side and said to him, 'Venerable ascetic!

source_sentence: 我今及諸弟子，欲入沙門法中，是事一切當如是持。』
translation: Now, I and my disciples want to enter the ascetic tradition, so we will thus maintain all these things.'

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊即告彼等螺髻梵志，作如是言：『汝等若能然是事者，當取汝等鹿皮之衣，及祭祀火器皿調度，悉棄擲著尼連河中。』
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed those conch-tufted priests and said, 'If you can do this, you will take your deerskin robes and sacrificial fire vessels and adjust them, and throw them all into the Nairañjanā.'

source_sentence: 彼等報言：『如沙門教，我不敢違。』
translation: They replied, 'As the ascetic taught, I dare not disobey you.'

source_sentence: 是時，彼等螺髻梵志，即持鹿皮及諸調度祭祀火物，悉擲河中，擲河中已，其諸皮衣軍持瓶罐，出種種聲，呹呹唱呴，隨流而下。
translation: Those conch-tufted priests then took the deerskin and the fire-regulating instruments and threw them all into the river, and after they were thrown into the river, the leather-clad soldiers holding the jars and pots made all kinds of noises, sang excitedly, and went downstream with the current.

source_sentence: 「爾時，彼諸螺髻梵志見如是等希有之事，復增歡喜，而白佛言：『善哉！
translation: "When those conch-tufted priests saw such a rare thing, they rejoiced and said to the Buddha, "Good!

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 與我出家及具足戒。』
translation: renounce the world and give me the full set of precepts.'

source_sentence: 佛即告言：『汝等比丘！
translation: The Buddha then told them, 'You monks!

source_sentence: 來入於我，自說法中，修行梵行，盡於諸苦。』
translation: They came to me, cultivated the religious practice in their own teaching, and ended all suffering.'

source_sentence: 是時，彼等諸長老輩，應聲出家，即成具戒。
translation: At that point, those elders responded by renouncing the family and fulfilling the precepts.

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊在彼優婁頻螺迦葉聚落之內，隨多少時，意樂住已，漸漸行向伽耶城邊。
translation: "At the time, the Bhagavān was inside that colony of Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa, and as often as he liked, he stayed there and gradually walked toward the edge of Gayā.

source_sentence: 如來在彼象頭山頂，將是一千比丘徒眾停住，即以三種神通，教化彼等，所謂身通、口通、意通，而調習之。
translation: At the top of that elephanthead mountain, the Tathāgata stopped this group of 1,000 monks and taught them with three kinds of supernormal abilities, which he called physical, verbal, and mental abilities, and trained them.

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊欲顯身通，所謂一身作於多身，多身還復作於一身，上沒下現，下沒上現，東沒西現，西沒東現，南沒北現，北沒南現，山崖石壁，能過無礙。
translation: "At the time, the Bhagavān wanted to demonstrate the bodily abilities, which are described as one body creating many bodies and many bodies creating one body, disappearing from above and below, disappearing from below and above, disappearing from east and west, disappearing from south and north, disappearing from north and south, and being able to pass over precipitous mountains and rock walls without obstruction.

source_sentence: 入地如水，履水如地，從地跏趺，昇陟虛空，猶如飛鳥。
translation: He enters the ground like water, steps on water like the ground, crosses his legs from the ground, and rises into the sky like a flying bird.

source_sentence: 身出烟炎，如大火聚，滅火現水，消水放火。
translation: Their bodies emit smoke and heat like a great ball of fire, which extinguishes fire and produces water, and they extinguish water and release fire.

source_sentence: 此之日月如是威德，而能以手摩捫捉持，乃至梵天自在行動。
translation: With such authority, the sun and moon can be held in the palm of their hands, even as the Brahmā gods move about freely.

source_sentence: 此是如來現身神通。
translation: This is the Tathāgata's supernormal power to show his body.

source_sentence: 「現口通者，『汝等比丘！
translation: "Those who demonstrate verbal supernormal power, 'You monks!

source_sentence: 今應當知如是分別，應當如是莫生分別，應當如是觀察思惟，應當如是莫思惟觀。
translation: Now, you should know such discrimination, should thus not make distinctions, should thus observe and contemplate, and should thus not contemplate and observe.

source_sentence: 汝等比丘！
translation: You monks!

source_sentence: 應如是證，莫如是證。
translation: You should thus realize it, but don't thus realize it.

source_sentence: 汝等比丘！
translation: You monks!

source_sentence: 應如是行，莫如是行。』
translation: Do as you should, and don't do as you should.'

source_sentence: 此是如來現口神通。
translation: This is the Tathāgata's present-mouth superknowledge.

source_sentence: 「現意通者，『汝等比丘！
translation: "Those who demonstrate the power of the mind, 'You monks!

source_sentence: 今應當知！
translation: Now you should know!

source_sentence: 此一切法，皆悉熾燃，言熾燃者，眼亦熾燃，色亦熾燃，眼識熾燃，眼觸熾燃，眼觸所因生者有受，若樂、若苦、非樂非苦，彼亦熾燃。
translation: "All these things are blazing, and when they're said to be blazing, the eye is also blazing, form is also blazing, the visual consciousness is blazing, visual contact is blazing, and whatever sensation arises from visual contact that's pleasant, painful, neither pleasant nor painful is also blazing.

source_sentence: 以何熾燃？
translation: What is it that's blazing?

source_sentence: 以慾火故煩惱熾燃，以瞋恚火煩惱熾燃，以愚癡火煩惱熾燃。
translation: Afflictions are blazing because of the fire of desire, afflictions are blazing because of the fire of anger, and afflictions are blazing because of the fire of foolishness.

source_sentence: 我如是說眼過，如是其耳熾燃，聲響熾燃，略說乃至鼻香熾燃，舌味熾燃，身觸熾燃，意法熾燃，因於意觸所生受者，若苦、若樂、非苦非樂，彼亦熾燃。
translation: Thus I've described the faults of the eye, so their ears are blazing, sounds are blazing, and, speaking briefly, even the smell of the nose is blazing, the taste of the tongue is blazing, bodily contact is blazing, and mental states are blazing, and whatever sensations are produced by mental contact that are painful, pleasant, neither painful nor pleasant are also blazing.

source_sentence: 以何熾燃？
translation: What is it that's blazing?

source_sentence: 以慾火故煩惱熾燃，以瞋恚火煩惱熾燃，以愚癡火煩惱熾燃，我如是說耳鼻舌身根塵過患。
translation: With afflictions blazing from the fires of desire, afflictions blazing from the fires of anger, and afflictions blazing from the fires of foolishness, I thus explain the faults of the sense faculties of the ear, nose, tongue, and body.

source_sentence: 「『復次若有多聞之人，能作如是深觀察者，彼能厭眼，厭離眼識，厭離眼觸，若因眼觸所生受者，若苦、若樂、非苦非樂，是中亦能如是厭離，是厭離眼。
translation: "'Furthermore, if there's a well-versed person who can make such a deep observation, they can become disillusioned with the eye, disillusioned with the visual consciousness, and disillusioned with visual contact, and if the sensations that arise from visual contact are painful, pleasant, neither painful nor pleasant, they can thus become disillusioned with them, which is disillusioned with the eye.'

source_sentence: 「『又復如是，厭離於耳，厭離於聲，乃至略說，厭離鼻香，厭離舌味，厭離身觸，厭離意法。
translation: "'Again, it's thus becoming disillusioned with the ear, disillusioned with sound, and even, to put it mildly, disillusioned with the smell of the nose, disillusioned with the taste of the tongue, disillusioned with physical contact, and disillusioned with mental factors.

source_sentence: 若因意觸所生受者，若樂、若苦、非樂非苦，彼亦厭離。
translation: If the sensations that arise from mental contact are pleasant, painful, or neither pleasant nor painful, they're also disillusioned with them.

source_sentence: 既厭離訖，即不染著，既不染著，即得解脫。
translation: Having become disillusioned with them, they then aren't defiled, and having become undefiled, they then attain liberation.

source_sentence: 既得解脫，即有如是內淨智現自知，我今生死已斷，梵行已立，所作已辦，不受後有。』
translation: Having attained liberation, that's when I have this internally pure knowledge that shows itself, 'Now that birth and death have been ended, the religious practice has been established, the task has been accomplished, and I won't be subject to a later existence.'

source_sentence: 此是如來意作神通。
translation: This is the Tathāgata's intention-to-work superknowledge.

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊作如是說三種神通教示之時，彼諸一千比丘徒眾，無為漏盡，於諸法中心得解脫。
translation: "When the Bhagavān thus explained the three kinds of supernormal abilities, those 1,000 monks and their followers ended the contaminants of nonbeing and attained liberation in the center of all dharmas.

source_sentence: 而有偈說：「『已斷生死諸慾流，　　已得梵行自利益，　　所作悉已皆成辦，　　更不受於後有生。』
translation: A verse then said, 'They have cut off the flow of desire through birth and death, have attained the self-benefit of the religious practice, have accomplished all of their undertakings, and won't be subject to birth in a later existence.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，彼諸一千比丘，聞佛世尊如是說已，於諸漏中，無復有為，即得內心善好解脫，捨梵志法，名聲聞僧。
translation: "After hearing the Bhagavān say this, those 1,000 monks had no more activity among the contaminants, and they attained liberation of good internal qualities, renounced the religious dharma, and were called śrāvaka monks.

source_sentence: 佛本行集經優波斯那品第四十五上
translation: Sutra of the Collection of the Past Activities of the Buddha (Upāsaka Chapter 45)

source_sentence: 「爾時，彼三迦葉兄弟，有一[外*男]甥螺髻梵志，其梵志名優波斯那(隋言最上征將)，住在一山，其所住山，名阿修羅，恒共二百五十螺髻梵志弟子修學仙道。
translation: "At the time, those three Kāśyapa brothers had a [male* male] nephew, a conch-tufted priest named Uposna (Sui term for supreme commander), who lived on a mountain called Asura and was always training in the immortal path with 250 conch-tufted priest disciples.

source_sentence: 彼聞其舅迦葉三人及諸弟子往詣於彼大沙門邊，悉皆出家，剃除鬚髮，聞已心驚，大不歡喜，而口發言：『希有舅等！
translation: When he heard that his uncle Kāśyapa and his disciples had gone to that great ascetic, all of whom had left home and shaved off their hair, he was startled and greatly displeased when he heard that, and he said, 'Rarely, uncle!'

source_sentence: 於若干年祭祀火神，今日忽已入沙門中為作弟子。
translation: After years of worshipping the fire deity, suddenly today I've entered the ascetic community as a disciple.

source_sentence: 我今當往彼處訶責，何故作是不善事也？』
translation: Now, I will go there and rebuke you, 'Why did you do such an unwholesome thing?'

source_sentence: 彼口中咽唧唧之聲，而往詣彼三阿舅邊，到已見其三阿舅，剃除鬚髮，著袈裟衣。
translation: With a whispering sound coming from his mouth, he went over to his three uncles and when he arrived, he saw them with their hair shaved off and wearing robes.

source_sentence: 見已向舅，而說偈言：「『舅等虛祀火百年，　　亦復空修彼苦行，　　今日同捨於此法，　　猶如蛇脫於故皮。』
translation: After he saw them, he spoke to them in verse, saying, 'Brothers, we've been sacrificing in vain for a hundred years, and we've also cultivated that ascetic practice in vain. Today, we're all abandoning this teaching together, just as a snake sheds its old skin.'

source_sentence: 「爾時彼舅迦葉三人，同共以偈報其[外*男]甥優波斯那，作如是言：「『我等昔空祀火神，　　亦復徒修於苦行，　　我等今日捨此法，　　實如蛇脫彼故皮。』
translation: "It was then that those three uncles, Kāśyapa and his [male] nephew Upāsaka, all spoke together in verse in response, saying, "We used to sacrifice to the fire deity in vain and also cultivated ascetic practices in vain; today, we abandon this teaching, just as a snake sheds its old skin."

source_sentence: 「爾時，兵將螺髻梵志聞說偈已，復反問彼三阿舅言：『此能勝也？』
translation: "After hearing that verse, the soldier general Conchita replied to those three uncles, "Is this superior?"

source_sentence: 是時，彼三阿舅報言：『此實勝也！
translation: The three uncles then reported, 'This is really something!'

source_sentence: 寧為此行，此行最妙。』
translation: Rather than doing this, this is the most wonderful thing you can do.'

source_sentence: 爾時，兵將螺髻梵志，告其二百五十螺髻梵志弟子，作如是言：『汝等梵志摩那婆輩！
translation: It was then that the army commander, the conch-tufted priest, addressed his 250 conch-tufted priest disciples and said, 'You priests, Manabhajans!

source_sentence: 我彼居處所有泉池并諸調度，汝意自知，作何處分；我今欲在大沙門邊修行梵行。』
translation: 'You should know what part you think of the springs and pools and preparations at my abode; now, I want to practice the religious life at the edge of that great monastery.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，彼等二百五十螺髻梵志，即便共白優波斯那螺髻梵志，作如是言：『和上今若欲往於彼大沙門邊行梵行者，我等亦當隨逐和上同詣彼邊，共修淨行。』
translation: "At the time, those 250 conch-tufted priests then said to the Upāsaka conch-tufted priest in common, 'If you want to go there now to practice your religious practice at the edge of the great ascetic, we will also follow you there to cultivate a pure practice together.'

source_sentence: 爾時，兵將螺髻梵志及諸弟子，往詣佛所，到佛所已，而白佛言：『大德沙門！
translation: It was then that the soldier general Conchakra and his disciples went to the Buddha, and when they arrived, they said to him, 'Venerable ascetic!

source_sentence: 我今願將諸弟子，入沙門法中，乃至是事，當如是持。』
translation: Now, I would like to have my disciples enter the ascetic tradition, even in this matter, and I will thus maintain it.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊告彼螺髻諸梵志言：『汝若然者，當自取汝鹿皮之衣，及祭火器，擲棄一邊。』
translation: "It was then that the Bhagavān addressed those priests in the conch-tuft, saying, 'If you do so, take your deerskin robe and fire-offering vessel and toss them aside.'

source_sentence: 而其彼等諸梵志言：『如沙門教，我等不違。』
translation: And those priests said, 'As the ascetic taught, we won't disobey.'

source_sentence: 即至居處將祭火具，擲著一邊。
translation: They then went to their abode and tossed aside the fire sacrifice.

source_sentence: 「爾時，梵志擲棄祭火器皿已後，還至佛所，到佛所已，頂禮佛足，而白佛言：『善哉！
translation: "After they threw away the fire-offering utensils, the priests returned to the Buddha, bowed their heads at his feet when they arrived, and said to him, 'Good!

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 與我出家及具足戒。』
translation: I'll leave home with you and give you the full precepts.'

source_sentence: 佛告彼等作如是言：『汝等比丘！
translation: The Buddha addressed them and said, 'You monks!

source_sentence: 來入於我自說法中，修於梵行，盡諸苦故。』
translation: Come and enter my own teaching, cultivate the religious practice, and end suffering.'

source_sentence: 而其彼等二百五十諸長老輩，應聲出家，即成具戒。
translation: Those 250 elders responded by renouncing the family and fulfilling the precepts.

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊即為彼等諸長老輩，增更說法，如前還以三種神通示教利喜。
translation: "The Bhagavān then spoke more and more for those elders, teaching and rejoicing them with the three kinds of supernormal abilities as before.

source_sentence: 是時，彼等於無為法，悉盡諸漏，心得解脫。
translation: At that point, they had all ended the contaminants in the Dharma of noncontrivance, and their minds were liberated.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊最初集聚諸比丘眾，所謂此等一千二百五十人俱，並悉從於梵志出家，皆阿羅漢，悉得自利，隨侍世尊，證會說法。」
translation: At that point, the Bhagavān first gathered together a group of monks, called the 1,250 of them, who had left home with the priests, were all arhats, had attained self-improvement, and were accompanying the Bhagavān as he realized the teaching."

source_sentence: 復次其後諸比丘等即白佛言：「善哉！
translation: Again, the monks who followed said to the Buddha, "Good!

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 彼等螺髻梵志師徒，往昔之時，種何善根？
translation: What good roots did those conch-tufted priest masters and their disciples plant in the past?

source_sentence: 今日並得出家受具，皆證羅漢？
translation: Today, did they all leave home, receive the complements, and realize the arhatship?

source_sentence: 昔作何業，今得是報？
translation: What activity did you do in the past that has now resulted in this reward?

source_sentence: 又彼長老優婁頻螺迦葉一人，共其五百螺髻梵志，而得為首，最妙最勝，最上最尊；那提迦葉三百弟子，為首為最，為勝為妙；伽耶迦葉二百弟子，為首為勝，為妙為尊。
translation: That one man, Elder Ulūkaśvara, along with 500 other conch-tufted priests, was made the head, the most wonderful, the most excellent, and the most venerable; 300 of Nadī-Kāśyapa's disciples were made the head, the most wonderful, and the most excellent; and 200 of Gayā-Kāśyapa's disciples were made the head, the most wonderful, and the most venerable.

source_sentence: 又復長老優婁頻螺迦葉往昔造於何業，今日世尊種種教示，如是難化自餘一切諸梵志等，易受於化。」
translation: Furthermore, what actions did the elder Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa perform in the past that the Bhagavān has taught in various ways today that make it difficult to teach all the other priests and so forth, and easy to teach them."

source_sentence: 作是語已，默然而住。
translation: After making these remarks, he waited silently.

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告諸比丘言：「汝諸比丘！
translation: At that point, the Buddha addressed the monks, saying, "You monks!

source_sentence: 至心諦聽！
translation: listen with utmost attention!

source_sentence: 我念往昔，還在於此閻浮提內，具足而有一千商人，彼商人中，有三兄弟，各為商主。
translation: I think back in the past, while there were fully a thousand merchants in this Jambudvīpa, there were three brothers among those merchants, each of whom was a merchant master.

source_sentence: 其一還名優婁頻螺迦葉，主領五百商人，第二還名那提迦葉，亦復主領三百商人，第三還名伽耶迦葉，亦然還領二百商人。
translation: One of them, Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa, led 500 merchants, the second, Nadī-Kāśyapa, also led 300 merchants, and the third, Gayā-Kāśyapa, likewise led 200 merchants.

source_sentence: 「爾時，彼等三大商主及諸商人，相共欲往海內治生，堪入海貨，莊嚴已訖。
translation: "At the time, these three great merchant masters and their merchants all wanted to go to the ocean to rule over life, and they were able to buy goods from the ocean and adorn them.

source_sentence: 其物價數，足直三百千萬金錢，一百千萬擬自食粮，一百千萬擬餘商人，以為本領，一百千萬擬雜用度，料理船舶。
translation: The price of their goods was worth exactly 3,000,000 gold coins, 1,000,000 for their own food, 1,000,000 for the rest of the merchants to take as their own, and 1,000,000 for miscellaneous provisions to take care of the ships.

source_sentence: 彼等如是莊嚴竟已，漸漸而行，至彼海岸。
translation: After they had finished decorating themselves in this way, they gradually traveled to their shores.

source_sentence: 至海岸已，供養祭祀大海之神，辦具船舫，其外倍價更雇五人，所謂善解調治船者、觀四方者、泝水入者、善浮水者、張施帆者。
translation: When they reach the shore, they make offerings to the god of the sea, prepare a boat, and hire five other men at double the price, which are called the man who well manages the boat, the man who observes the four directions, the man who sails into the water, the man who floats well in the water, and the man who spreads the sail.

source_sentence: 既如是得彼五人已，其三商主，大聲唱言：『誰能入海？
translation: After they had thus acquired these five men, three of their merchants shouted out, saying, 'Who can enter the sea?'

source_sentence: (三稱)』如是三聲大唱告已，即坐舶上，相共入海，為求財故。
translation: (After these three great announcements, they sat down on board the ship and went into the ocean together, seeking to obtain property.

source_sentence: 彼等既至大海之中，忽遇黑風，彼風吹船，擲海潬上，僉然而住。
translation: When they reached the middle of the ocean, they suddenly encountered a black wind, which blew the ship and threw it over a sea of PPP, where it stayed together.

source_sentence: 佛本行集經卷第四十二
translation: Sutra on the Collection of the Past Activities of the Buddha, Volume 42
